body.p:
Since I wrote you last, there has been a
Board meeting of Trustees who referenced Mr Lyons letter to
the Congregation which was convened on Sunday 23d met at
11 ock when the Pastoral letter of Rev E. Lyons excommunicating
Dr. E. and denouncing the congregation for acting inconsistently
and forfeiting all claim to orthodoxy &c and also to his
approbation._.was laid before the meeting, its reading created
commingled feelings of mirth, indignation, and pity, for
the ignorance Our visible faculties could not but be excited
at the high f?ed nonsense in which it was couched, indignation
at his impertinence in excommunicating Dr. E. and Taking
exception at the action of the whole congregation, and leaving
them suddenly without any one to officiate on Sabbath (the
Synagogue was without service on that day) The resignation was
accordingly accepted by a close vote, altho there was none
who would have opposed it if it had not have been for his
family, however principle prevailed against pity and misplaced
pity, and his resignation was accepted and the proceedings
of the primary meeting endorsed by this,—immediately followed
a resolution, repudiating Mr Lyons ‚charge‚ that the congregation
had acted inconsistently or had departed from their principles
which way passed unanimously,—this having been done and
Dr. E. position sustained by the congregation. The Secretary produced
a letter from Dr. E. requesting the Congregation to excuse him
from delivering the lecture on the day appointed,—this letter called

forth a resolution from Sam Hart Jr. appreciating the delicate
motives which induced Dr. E to decline, and endorsing his character
in a proper manner. A Resolution was also offered insiting
Mr Lyons to declaring the office vacant and empowering the
Trustees to advertise for a Hazan & lecturer at such salary at
the option of the Trustees, which will be I expect $1000.

Mr Lyons was also invited to perform officiate during the
Hollidays and as long after as suits his convenience—this was
done to prevent the Synagogue from being closed, a Gentleman
present was instructed to say Mr Lyons would do so, thus ended
the meeting. Mr Lyons played a deep game, but the wrong
color bring came up tramps?, & he lost the game it.

You can appreciate this act of Mr Lyons—when
I tell you he has said since, that he would not have made
objection if he had been consulted but it seems his pride was
touched, he was elected he says in his letter as the Spiritual
adviser of the congregation, (he was only elected only as reader) the
minutes of the election were referred to at the meeting to prove it), he told Mr
Sam Hart, that the congregation should have asked him to deliver
a lecture—and not another,—he was amazed at your? officiating
when here, and expressed himself so, but he was afraid of you
therefore he did not boldly come forward, then, but the B E Minister?
was a fine chance for him, and he greedily swallowed the bait
hook and all and now hangs suspended, displaying to the world not his
religion nor any of its attributes, Dr. E. & a poor man
whom he Lyons told me had acted upon correct principles, which he approved
of,—an opportunity was made to introduce him into the
Mobile Synagogue by the recognition of the Shrileth? Conn.
and instructed of assisting him, (by silence if even he thought

it was not consonant with his ideas of Orthodox principles, he
denounces, excommunicates, and anathemizes, not only Dr E—
but the whole congregation for countenancing him, and resigns
his situation giving this as his reason, when in reality the
man is devoid of principle and it was done from sheer spite
because he could not shine along side of a brighter constellation

I am called off and must conclude—kind regards to all
friends—Mr Valentine will send you official extracts from the
minutes of the congregation.
I heard Rev M Myer on Saturday.

Friday yesterday I recd your letter, I have set the ball
in motion and I am sure that some effort will be at
once made to call a public meeting and take the sense of
the congregation on the subject,

If elected—Could you not come on for Rossanna & Kippur
and then get leave of absence for a couple of months after
to finish your business.— Valentine intends to write
you and send in resolutions of last meeting.

There is only one objection in the way,—which you
would have to remove yourself. Our
constitution provides that no Minister shall be elected
for a longer period than two years,—The constitution
might be attend but this would require time and
if you were once elected and accepted, the congregation
would be only too glad to keep you, I see no reason
why they should prevent your accepting.
